## Description {#details}

This file describes how to lower LLVM code to machine code.

This has two main components:


<ul>
<li>Which ValueTypes are natively supported by the target.</li>
<li>Which operations are supported for supported ValueTypes.</li>
<li>Cost thresholds for alternative implementations of certain operations.</li>
</ul>


In addition it has a few other components, like information about FP immediates.

<SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="785"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if the target should transform:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="786"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (X &amp; Y) == Y ---&gt; (~X &amp; Y) == 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="787"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (X &amp; Y) != Y ---&gt; (~X &amp; Y) != 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="789"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This may be profitable if the target has a bitwise and-not operation that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="790"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// sets comparison flags. A target may want to limit the transformation based</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00791" /><CodeLine lineNumber="791"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// on the type of Y or if Y is a constant.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="792"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="793"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Note that the transform will not occur if Y is known to be a power-of-2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// because a mask and compare of a single bit can be handled by inverting the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="795"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// predicate, for example:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="796"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (X &amp; 8) == 8 ---&gt; (X &amp; 8) != 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#aad4749fd44e2f7c1b8908f6d5e8a9d1f"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#aad4749fd44e2f7c1b8908f6d5e8a9d1f">hasAndNotCompare</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#a262774d3e5186511427e5b2414a85f7f">Y</a>)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="799"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="800"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if the target has a bitwise and-not operation:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="802"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// X = ~A &amp; B</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="803"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This can be used to simplify select or other instructions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a0a48578bc58c1f6df62722a7bb561349"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a0a48578bc58c1f6df62722a7bb561349">hasAndNot</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the target has the more complex version of this operation, assume that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it has this operation too.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#aad4749fd44e2f7c1b8908f6d5e8a9d1f">hasAndNotCompare</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if the target has a bit-test instruction:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="811"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   (X &amp; (1 &lt;&lt; Y)) ==/!= 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This knowledge can be used to prevent breaking the pattern,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// or creating it if it could be recognized.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a3f18615ecb42a0876e0fa80136629d39"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a3f18615ecb42a0876e0fa80136629d39">hasBitTest</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#a262774d3e5186511427e5b2414a85f7f">Y</a>)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// There are two ways to clear extreme bits (either low or high):</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Mask:    x &amp;  (-1 &lt;&lt; y)  (the instcombine canonical form)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Shifts:  x &gt;&gt; y &lt;&lt; y</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if the variant with 2 variable shifts is preferred.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return false if there is no preference.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#ab3d7ae47cc6ea1b57a087cd22f50a5f9"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#ab3d7ae47cc6ea1b57a087cd22f50a5f9">shouldFoldMaskToVariableShiftPair</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// By default, let&#39;s assume that no one prefers shifts.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if it is profitable to fold a pair of shifts into a mask.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This is usually true on most targets. But some targets, like Thumb1,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// have immediate shift instructions, but no immediate &quot;and&quot; instruction;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// this makes the fold unprofitable.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a6ea263078f271d4d5e25764ef77d2878"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a6ea263078f271d4d5e25764ef77d2878">shouldFoldConstantShiftPairToMask</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdnode">SDNode</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="835"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Should we tranform the IR-optimal check for whether given truncation</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="836"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// down into KeptBits would be truncating or not:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="837"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   (add %x, (1 &lt;&lt; (KeptBits-1))) srccond (1 &lt;&lt; KeptBits)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="838"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Into it&#39;s more traditional form:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="839"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   ((%x &lt;&lt; C) a&gt;&gt; C) dstcond %x</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="842" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a583ad984c8f06e187574d2c0e6b137d5"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a583ad984c8f06e187574d2c0e6b137d5">shouldTransformSignedTruncationCheck</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt">EVT</a> XVT,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="843"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> KeptBits)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="844"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// By default, let&#39;s assume that no one prefers shifts.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="845"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="846"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00847" /><CodeLine lineNumber="847"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00848" /><CodeLine lineNumber="848"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Given the pattern</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00849" /><CodeLine lineNumber="849"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   (X &amp; (C l&gt;&gt;/&lt;&lt; Y)) ==/!= 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00850" /><CodeLine lineNumber="850"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// return true if it should be transformed into:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="851"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   ((X &lt;&lt;/l&gt;&gt; Y) &amp; C) ==/!= 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="852"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// WARNING: if &#39;X&#39; is a constant, the fold may deadlock!</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00853" /><CodeLine lineNumber="853"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FIXME: we could avoid passing XC, but we can&#39;t use isConstOrConstSplat()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00854" /><CodeLine lineNumber="854"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///        here because it can end up being not linked in.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="855" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a9bd4abfb6bf968505c7417e2b2532236"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a9bd4abfb6bf968505c7417e2b2532236">shouldProduceAndByConstByHoistingConstFromShiftsLHSOfAnd</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00856" /><CodeLine lineNumber="856"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantsdnode">ConstantSDNode</a> &#42;XC, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantsdnode">ConstantSDNode</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a77c69067ae8279bc00ab8757731e90d7">CC</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#a262774d3e5186511427e5b2414a85f7f">Y</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="857"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> OldShiftOpcode, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NewShiftOpcode,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="858"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> &amp;DAG)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00859" /><CodeLine lineNumber="859"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a3f18615ecb42a0876e0fa80136629d39">hasBitTest</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#ab60f28d7a141ac46ccc200176a1bca8b">X</a>, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/tablegenbackendskeleton-cpp/#a262774d3e5186511427e5b2414a85f7f">Y</a>)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00860" /><CodeLine lineNumber="860"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// One interesting pattern that we&#39;d want to form is &#39;bit test&#39;:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00861" /><CodeLine lineNumber="861"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   ((1 &lt;&lt; Y) &amp; C) ==/!= 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00862" /><CodeLine lineNumber="862"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// But we also need to be careful not to try to reverse that fold.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00863" /><CodeLine lineNumber="863"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00864" /><CodeLine lineNumber="864"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Is this &#39;1 &lt;&lt; Y&#39; ?</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00865" /><CodeLine lineNumber="865"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (OldShiftOpcode == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a8cc94e03dea594863073a02f5bb94997">ISD::SHL</a> &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a77c69067ae8279bc00ab8757731e90d7">CC</a>-&gt;isOne())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00866" /><CodeLine lineNumber="866"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Keep the &#39;bit test&#39; pattern.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00867" /><CodeLine lineNumber="867"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00868" /><CodeLine lineNumber="868"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Will it be &#39;1 &lt;&lt; Y&#39; after the transform ?</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00869" /><CodeLine lineNumber="869"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (XC &amp;&amp; NewShiftOpcode == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a8cc94e03dea594863073a02f5bb94997">ISD::SHL</a> &amp;&amp; XC-&gt;isOne())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00870" /><CodeLine lineNumber="870"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Do form the &#39;bit test&#39; pattern.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="871"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00872" /><CodeLine lineNumber="872"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00873" /><CodeLine lineNumber="873"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If &#39;X&#39; is a constant, and we transform, then we will immediately</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00874" /><CodeLine lineNumber="874"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// try to undo the fold, thus causing endless combine loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00875" /><CodeLine lineNumber="875"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// So by default, let&#39;s assume everyone prefers the fold</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00876" /><CodeLine lineNumber="876"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// iff &#39;X&#39; is not a constant.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00877" /><CodeLine lineNumber="877"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> !XC;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00878" /><CodeLine lineNumber="878"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00879" /><CodeLine lineNumber="879"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00880" /><CodeLine lineNumber="880"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Return true if its desirable to perform the following transform:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00885" /><CodeLine lineNumber="885"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00886" /><CodeLine lineNumber="886"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is only queried after we have verified the transform will be bitwise</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2261"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Inserts in the IR a target-specific intrinsic specifying a fence.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2262"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// It is called by AtomicExpandPass before expanding an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2263"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   AtomicRMW/AtomicCmpXchg/AtomicStore/AtomicLoad</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2264"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   if shouldInsertFencesForAtomic returns true.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2265"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2266"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Inst is the original atomic instruction, prior to other expansions that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2267"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// may be performed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2268"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2269"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This function should either return a nullptr, or a pointer to an IR-level</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2270"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   Instruction&#42;. Even complex fence sequences can be represented by a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2271"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   single Instruction&#42; through an intrinsic to be lowered later.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2272"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2273"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The default implementation emits an IR fence before any release (or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2274"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   stronger) operation that stores, and after any acquire (or stronger)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2275"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   operation. This is generally a correct implementation, but backends may</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2276"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   override if they wish to use alternative schemes (e.g. the PowerPC</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2277"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   standard ABI uses a fence before a seq&#95;cst load instead of after a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2278"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   seq&#95;cst store).</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2363"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// On some platforms, an AtomicRMW that never actually modifies the value</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2364"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (such as fetch&#95;add of 0) can be turned into a fence followed by an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2365"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// atomic load. This may sound useless, but it makes it possible for the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2366"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// processor to keep the cacheline shared, dramatically improving</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2367"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// performance. And such idempotent RMWs are useful for implementing some</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2368"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// kinds of locks, see for example (justification + benchmarks):</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2369"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// http://www.hpl.hp.com/techreports/2012/HPL-2012-68.pdf</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2370"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This method tries doing that transformation, returning the atomic load if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2371"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// it succeeds, and nullptr otherwise.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2372"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If shouldExpandAtomicLoadInIR returns true on that load, it will undergo</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2373"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// another round of expansion.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2374"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loadinst">LoadInst</a> &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3107"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// used to generate a sequence of loads that is easier to combine into a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// paired load.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3109"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For instance, something like this:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3110"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a = load i64&#42; addr</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3111"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// b = trunc i64 a to i32</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3112"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// c = lshr i64 a, 32</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3113"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// d = trunc i64 c to i32</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3114"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// will be optimized into:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3115"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// b = load i32&#42; addr1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// d = load i32&#42; addr2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3117"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Where addr1 = addr2 +/- sizeof(i32).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3118"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3119"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// In other words, unless the target performs a post-isel load combining,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3120"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// this information should not be provided because it will generate more</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3121"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// loads.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03691" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3691"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\brief Specify maximum number of store instructions per memset call.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03693" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3693"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// When lowering \\@llvm.memset this field specifies the maximum number of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03694" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3694"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// store operations that may be substituted for the call to memset. Targets</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03696" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3696"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// should assume that the memset will be done using as many of the largest</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03697" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3697"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// store operations first, followed by smaller ones, if necessary, per</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03698" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3698"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// alignment restrictions. For example, storing 9 bytes on a 32-bit machine</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3699"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// with 16-bit alignment would result in four 2-byte stores and one 1-byte</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l04334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4334"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// optimize LogicOp(SETCC0, SETCC1). An example (what is implemented as of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l05542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5542"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Legalize a SETCC or VP&#95;SETCC with given LHS and RHS and condition code CC</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5543"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// on the current target. A VP&#95;SETCC will additionally be given a Mask</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5544"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// and/or EVL not equal to SDValue().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5545"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5546"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If the SETCC has been legalized using AND / OR, then the legalized node</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5547"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// will be stored in LHS. RHS and CC will be set to SDValue(). NeedInvert</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5548"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// will be set to false. This will also hold if the VP&#95;SETCC has been</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5549"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// legalized using VP&#95;AND / VP&#95;OR.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5550"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5551"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If the SETCC / VP&#95;SETCC has been legalized by using</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5552"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// getSetCCSwappedOperands(), then the values of LHS and RHS will be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5553"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// swapped, CC will be set to the new condition, and NeedInvert will be set</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5554"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to false.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5555"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5556"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If the SETCC / VP&#95;SETCC has been legalized using the inverse condcode,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5557"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// then LHS and RHS will be unchanged, CC will set to the inverted condcode,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5558"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// and NeedInvert will be set to true. The caller must invert the result of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5559"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the SETCC with SelectionDAG::getLogicalNOT() or take equivalent action to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5560"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// swap the effect of a true/false result.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5561"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5562"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns true if the SETCC / VP&#95;SETCC has been legalized, false if it</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l05563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5563"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// hasn&#39;t.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
